summary: Ross L. Crozier, also known as Agent VAIVADA and Arthur G. Vaivada, was involved in CIA operations, including Project HUMANOID in Costa Rica. The documents span from 1952 to 1975, detailing his contract extensions, operational clearance requests, and suitability for contact agent work. He was considered for promotion and his file includes a historical listing of organizations deemed subversive by the Attorney General. The documents also cover diverse subjects such as agent activities in Mexico, approval for operational contacts in Havana, modifications to agent contracts, project authorizations in Costa Rica, and personnel matters like contract terminations and establishment of military cover backstops.
significance: The provided documents do not explicitly link Ross L. Crozier to the JFK assassination. His significance lies in his involvement in CIA operations and projects in Central America during the specified period.
